schemes.name: Paramparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana (PKVY)
schemes.description: Supports formation of organic farming clusters with assistance for organic inputs, certification and market linkage.
schemes.benefits: Reduced input cost, certified organic produce and better market price realization.
schemes.eligibility: Groups of farmers adopting organic farming under cluster or FPO model.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through State Organic Mission or designated implementing agencies.

schemes.name: National Project on Organic Farming (NPOF)
schemes.description: Provides support for organic input production units, bio-fertilizers, compost and organic certification systems.
schemes.benefits: Improved availability of organic inputs and promotion of organic practices.
schemes.eligibility: Entrepreneurs, cooperatives, FPOs and organic farmer groups.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through National Centre of Organic Farming or State Nodal Agencies.

schemes.name: National Mission for Sustainable Agriculture (NMSA)
schemes.description: Promotes soil health management, rainfed area development and climate-resilient farming practices.
schemes.benefits: Improved soil fertility, water efficiency and climate resilience.
schemes.eligibility: Farmers in notified rainfed and climate-vulnerable regions.

schemes.name: Subsidy Assistance for Bio-Fertilizers & Organic Inputs
schemes.department: Department of Agriculture, Government of Karnataka
schemes.description: Provides subsidy for bio-fertilizers, vermicompost and approved organic inputs.
schemes.benefits: Lower cultivation cost and increased adoption of eco-friendly inputs.
schemes.eligibility: Registered farmers purchasing notified organic inputs.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through Raitha Samparka Kendra (RSK) or Agriculture Department.

schemes.name: Organic Farming Research & Demonstration Programmes
schemes.department: University of Agricultural Sciences / Department of Agriculture
schemes.description: Conducts farmer field schools, organic demonstration plots and training programmes.
schemes.benefits: Skill development, awareness and improved adoption of organic practices.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through KVKs or Agriculture Universities.

schemes.name: Participatory Guarantee System (PGS) Organic Certification
schemes.description: Provides a low-cost organic certification system enabling access to organic markets.
schemes.benefits: Certified produce, premium pricing and consumer trust.
schemes.eligibility: Organic farmer groups registered under PGS-India.
schemes.how_to_apply: Register through PGS-India portal or facilitating agencies.

schemes.name: National Mission on Natural Farming (NMNF)
schemes.description: Promotes natural farming practices with training, on-field support and farmer capacity building.
schemes.benefits: Reduced cultivation cost, improved soil health and sustainable yields.
schemes.eligibility: Farmers adopting natural or low-input farming practices.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through State Agriculture Department or Nodal Agencies.
